content: On November 16, 1992, the Atlanta Braves made a significant move by trading for pitcher Greg Maddux, who would go on to become one of the greatest pitchers in baseball history. Maddux, a four-time Cy Young Award winner, signed with the Braves after spending five seasons with the Chicago Cubs. His arrival not only bolstered the Braves' pitching staff but also helped propel the team to a remarkable run of success in the 1990s, including a World Series championship in 1995.
